Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CZS-4 (cruzioseptin-4; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, UCLL1c; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: the splendid leaf frog,Cruziohyla calcarifer, Central and South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (86.96%) toCZS-2V: 17%, L:13%. GRAVY: 0.717; mol Wt: 2446.873; mol formula: C112H185N29O31; mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 13.09 uM), S. aureus (MIC 26.18 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 52.36 uM).Parasites: T. cruzi Trypomastigotes (IC50 1.55 uM) or Amastigotes (IC50 30.65 uM), P. falciparum NF54 (IC50 13.86 uM) or TM90C2B (IC50 4.87 uM), L. Mexicana (IC50 0.09 uM).In vitro toxicity: 4% RBC: hemolysis of 13% at 128 uM (HC50>100 uM), low hemo.lytic.
Literature Information.Author: Proaño-Bolaños C, Morán-Marcillo G, Espinosa de Los Monteros-Silva N, Bermúdez-Puga S, Salazar MA, Blasco-Zúñiga A, Cuesta S, Molina C, Espinosa F, Meneses L, Rojas-Silva P, Zapata Mena S, Sáenz FE, Rivera I M, Costales JA.2024
Literature Information.Title: Bioactivity of synthetic peptides from Ecuadorian frog skin secretions against Leishmania mexicana, Plasmodium falciparum, and Trypanosoma cruzi.
